theoryTitle: Jailer Beasts Are Failed Awakening Experiments
theoryText: The Jailer Beasts of Impel Down, including the Minotaurus introduced in Episode 422, are the result of failed Zoan Devil Fruit awakening attempts. The theory suggests that the World Government or Impel Down authorities attempted to forcibly awaken Zoan users to create powerful guards, but the process failed, causing the users to lose their humanity and become mindless beasts. This would explain their monstrous appearance, incredible durability, and lack of complex thought.
author: Various One Piece Fan Communities
platform: Worstgen Forum / Reddit / One Piece Forums
supportingEvidence: Crocodile later explains that the Jailer Beasts are awakened Zoan users
Their degraded personalities suggest unsuccessful awakening
They demonstrate incredible durability and recovery, traits of awakened Zoans
Oda confirmed in SBS that Zoan awakening carries significant risks
The beasts show no sign of human intelligence despite being former humans
counterEvidence: Not explicitly confirmed whether the awakening was intentional or accidental
No direct statement that these were experimental subjects
Could be naturally awakened Zoans who lost themselves to the animal nature
relatedTheories: CP9 members who disappeared may have been subjected to forced awakening attempts
Level 6 prisoners could have been used as awakening test subjects

sourceUrls.title: Theory on Zoan Awakenings, the risk, the failure and the true form
Cipher Pol can trigger Awakenings in Zoan users

theoryText: Some fans theorize that Garp's apparent passivity during Ace's imprisonment at Impel Down was actually strategic. Rather than being cowardly, Garp may have been playing a careful political game, knowing that any overt action to save Ace would compromise the Marines and potentially start a larger war prematurely. By visiting Ace and having emotionally charged conversations, Garp was actually gathering intelligence and assessing the situation while maintaining his position of trust within the Marines.
author: One Piece Fan Communities
supportingEvidence: Garp's position allowed him to visit Ace when others couldn't
His emotional conversation with Ace revealed important information about Ace's parentage
Garp's internal conflict is well-documented throughout the series
He remained in position to potentially influence events at Marineford
counterEvidence: Garp took no direct action to save Ace
His inaction ultimately contributed to Ace's death
Multiple opportunities to act were not taken
Garp himself expressed deep regret over his choices
relatedTheories: Garp intentionally let Luffy through during Marineford
Garp's ties to Roger influenced his handling of Ace's situation

sourceUrls.title: Garp is a coward: Heated Debate Erupts Among One Piece Fans

theoryTitle: Impel Down Level 6 Contains Rocks Pirates Members
theoryText: A popular theory suggests that Level 6 of Impel Down, the deepest and most secret level, contains imprisoned members of the legendary Rocks Pirates crew. This would explain why Level 6 is kept so secret and why the World Government is so protective of its prisoners. The theory gained traction following hints about the God Valley incident and the Rocks Pirates' defeat.
author: One Piece Theory Communities
supportingEvidence: Level 6 prisoners are kept extremely secret
The World Government erases existence records of some Level 6 inmates
God Valley incident was covered up by the World Government
Timing of Rocks Pirates defeat aligns with Impel Down's importance
Level 6's existence wasn't publicly known until the Impel Down arc
counterEvidence: No direct evidence of Rocks Pirates members in Impel Down
Most powerful pirates from that era may have been executed
The secrecy could be for other reasons
Later revelations show most Level 6 inmates are more recent prisoners
relatedTheories: Rocks D. Xebec himself might be imprisoned rather than dead
Level 6 contains prisoners who know too much about the Void Century

theoryTitle: Impel Down Will Have a Second Infiltration
theoryText: Fans theorize that before One Piece ends, there will be another infiltration of Impel Down, potentially to rescue someone or to free dangerous allies. This theory suggests that the detailed worldbuilding of Impel Down in episodes like 422 is setup for a future return to the location, possibly in the final saga.
author: One Piece Theory Communities
supportingEvidence: Oda rarely creates detailed locations without revisiting them
Multiple important characters are now imprisoned in Impel Down post-timeskip
The prison's security has been upgraded after Luffy's infiltration
Some revolutionaries and allies have been captured and imprisoned there
The World Government's secrets in Level 6 remain largely unexplored
counterEvidence: The series is approaching its end with limited time for new arcs
Luffy's infiltration already served its narrative purpose
Returning to Impel Down might feel repetitive
Most strategic prisoners have already escaped or been executed
relatedTheories: Sabo might be imprisoned in Impel Down after recent events
A massive prison break could occur during the final war

sourceUrls.title: One Piece: Will There Be An Impel Down Part 2?
